TopicTitle: Buildings Fully Upgraded on start of Career!

Articles.Content:
When I started a new career save in my game, all the buildings are set at tier 3. Another problem is that when I enter the VAB/SPH the interiors are set to tier 1. (I'm on KSP 0.90 64bit)

These are the mods I'm using:

Procedural farings

Procedural parts (and some texture packs)

RLA stock-alike

Tantares/Tantares LV

Stock-alike station parts

AIES (0.23)

Near future solar

Dmagic orbital science

KAS

RCS build aid

Mechjeb 2

Kerbal alarm clock

Tweakable everything

EVE

Texture replacer

planetshine

hotrockets FX

Astronomer's interstellar pack V2

RealChute

BoxSAT

USI Sounding Rockets

SumDum SMS

Aerojet Kerbodyne

So does anyone know what mod is causing this and or how to edit the save so it goes back to teir 1?

(First post!)

Hi,

Your problem is not with a mod, but rather with the 64-bit version of KSP. There is a unity-engine-level bug making those buildings appear upgraded, even though they aren't, which leads you to not be able to upgrade them and receive the added benefits and functions. This is a known bug, though I don't have any links for you. I don't think there is a way to fix it at the moment.

Well that's too bad. I hope it's fixed in the next update. Thanks anyway!

Edit: By the way, i love your mod TriggerAu.

There is a fix, it's a rough patch to be honest, but it will allow you to play the game.

Find the bit in your persistent.sfs file that says this:

 [COLOR=#333333]SCENARIO[/COLOR]    {
        name = ScenarioUpgradeableFacilities
        scene = 5, 6, 7, 8
        SpaceCenter/LaunchPad
        {
            lvl = 0
        }
        SpaceCenter/Runway
        {
            lvl = 0
        }
        SpaceCenter/VehicleAssemblyBuilding
        {
            lvl = 0
        }
        SpaceCenter/SpaceplaneHangar
        {
            lvl = 0
        }
        SpaceCenter/TrackingStation
        {
            lvl = 0
        }
        SpaceCenter/AstronautComplex
        {
            lvl = 0
        }
        SpaceCenter/MissionControl
        {
            lvl = 0
        }
        SpaceCenter/ResearchAndDevelopment
        {
            lvl = 0
        }
        SpaceCenter/Administration
        {
            lvl = 0
        }
        SpaceCenter/FlagPole
        {
            lvl = 0
        } [COLOR=#333333] } [/COLOR]

Make sure to backup your file before making any changes.

Change that section of the file to this

 [COLOR=#333333]SCENARIO    {[/COLOR]        name = ScenarioUpgradeableFacilities
        scene = 5, 6, 7, 8
        SpaceCenter/LaunchPad
        {
            lvl = 3
        }
        SpaceCenter/Runway
        {
            lvl = 3
        }
        SpaceCenter/VehicleAssemblyBuilding
        {
            lvl = 3
        }
        SpaceCenter/SpaceplaneHangar
        {
            lvl = 3
        }
        SpaceCenter/TrackingStation
        {
            lvl = 3
        }
        SpaceCenter/AstronautComplex
        {
            lvl = 3
        }
        SpaceCenter/MissionControl
        {
            lvl = 3
        }
        SpaceCenter/ResearchAndDevelopment
        {
            lvl = 3
        }
        SpaceCenter/Administration
        {
            lvl = 3
        }
        SpaceCenter/FlagPole
        {
            lvl = 3 [COLOR=#333333]  } [/COLOR]

This will allow your buildings to not only SHOW as fully upgraded, but function as fully upgraded too. Whilst the number 3 might not be the correct number for fully upgraded buildings, KSP will understand it and change the numbers to what it wants for fully upgraded, and I wasn't prepared to submit a fix based on what I thought worked, choosing instead to submit a fix that I actually knew worked, since I did it myself that way
